title: hack3rcon
author: hack3rcon
content: Hello,To swap 240,000,000 BRISE to BUSD, how much BNB is needed?Thank you.

comments.author: Bttzed03
comments.body: $1 worth of BNB should be more than enough for both smart contract approval of BRISE and the swap confirmation. I can't be precise because I don't have that token. Transaction fees (gas limit to be more specific) is different per token. It depends on how it's been coded.You'll get exact figure if you go to DEX like Pancakeswap > choose BRISE/BUSD pairing > click 'Enable'. Metamask will pop up after that asking for permission and show you the gas price. Next to that is the actual swapping.

comments.author: smartaction
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on July 25, 2022, 10:40:55 AMHello,To swap 240,000,000 BRISE to BUSD, how much BNB is needed?It is not stable. it can Change any time by transcation traffic every times. But since it's on the bsc chain I don't think the maximum fee will be more than $2 if you swap your token on DEX. you can check it yourself. the fee amount will show when you go for swap it.

comments.author: hack3rcon
comments.body: Quote from: smartaction on July 25, 2022, 11:27:38 AMQuote from: hack3rcon on July 25, 2022, 10:40:55 AMHello,To swap 240,000,000 BRISE to BUSD, how much BNB is needed?It is not stable. it can Change any time by transcation traffic every times. But since it's on the bsc chain I don't think the maximum fee will be more than $2 if you swap your token on DEX. you can check it yourself. the fee amount will show when you go for swap it.Thank you.How to solve its price change when swapping? Should I add ".00" to end of its price?

comments.author: Miaallen
comments.body: Transaction fees vary from time to time depending on traffic on the transaction at a certain period of time. And no matter how high the traffic may be, the fee can't be more $0.5 irrespective of what you're sending on binance chain.

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: You can have a full view of the chart for the BSC to calculate or check how much is the current fee the network is asking.(https://bscscan.com/gastracker)The link below is quite delayed by one day though.(https://ycharts.com/indicators/binance_smart_chain_average_transaction_fee_es)

comments.author: X-ray
comments.body: It must be less than a half of dollar. Doing swap on BSC was very cheap. I suggest you to put at least $1 for that to avoid once the fees was increasing a little bit. The price change actually depend on the how much liquidity that available in the pool. I have been checking it https://www.dextools.io/app/bnb/pair-explorer/0x7dd308207c0e700466cafda79f0218d898c211f8It seems like the liquidity was good and so there was not problem in the price change. I meant a small slippage may happen but that would not be a big problem for you.

comments.author: yohananaomi
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on July 25, 2022, 10:40:55 AMHello,To swap 240,000,000 BRISE to BUSD, how much BNB is needed?Thank you.looks like you can do a simulation before you do the exchange, because it can be done.looking at CMC it seems that you can trade on PancakeSwap to become BUSD.but usually if the transaction on the BSC network can be said to be quite cheap, it's probably not up to $1 you can already do it.once again exchange will always be subject to change with the situation whether the traffic is busy or not but because the bsc network can be said to be definitely cheap, don't hesitate to exchange if you are ready.

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on July 25, 2022, 11:40:17 AMHow to solve its price change when swapping? Should I add ".00" to end of its price?You can't do anything about price changes, that's how Automated Market Maker (AMM) works. If you get the right price when you make a swap, you should execute it as soon as possible. Because the more trades that occur, it will greatly affect the price (it can go up and down).

comments.author: WalkerIVIV
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on July 25, 2022, 11:40:17 AMHow to solve its price change when swapping? Should I add ".00" to end of its price?It can't be solved. The developers must have added more liquidity to make the slippage become even lower than before. The only problem is when you are facing a huge impact of slippage and you have no choice other than agreed to swap your token. It's better if you are using cex but im sure that if brise has enough liquidity to solve your problem. A small impact in the price means nothing for sure. Im sure that you are aware maybe the price may slightly change due to the liqudity

comments.author: MFahad
comments.body: Quote from: hack3rcon on July 25, 2022, 10:40:55 AMHello,To swap 240,000,000 BRISE to BUSD, how much BNB is needed?Thank you.You created account in April 2021 and also you got 10 Merit but you don't know how much bnb is required to swap in Bsc network.Anyway Swapping Fee is always different. If slippage is more than 10 you will be charged 1.5$ fee for approving and swapping. If less than 10 than 1$ is ok.Always disconnect wallet from Dex after swap because we approve sign in these Dex and hacker can steal our Bnb and other assets.
